message.content:
Here is a one-week healthy meal plan that takes into account your dietary restrictions:

Monday:
Breakfast: Oatmeal with mixed berries, chia seeds, and a drizzle of maple syrup.
Lunch: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, and an olive oil vinaigrette.
Dinner: Baked salmon with roasted vegetables (carrots, broccoli, and bell peppers) and quinoa.
Snack: Apple slices with sunflower seed butter.

Tuesday:
Breakfast: Scrambled tofu with spinach, mushrooms, and whole wheat toast.
Lunch: Lentil soup with a side salad of mixed greens and cherry tomatoes.
Dinner: Stir-fry with tofu, broccoli, onions, and brown rice.
Snack: Carrot sticks with hummus.

Wednesday:
Breakfast: Smoothie made with frozen mango, pineapple, coconut milk, and a scoop of protein powder.
Lunch: Whole wheat pita filled with grilled vegetables (zucchini, eggplant, and bell peppers) and tahini sauce.
Dinner: Baked sweet potato topped with black beans, salsa, and avocado.
Snack: Rice cakes with mashed avocado and a sprinkle of sea salt.

Thursday:
Breakfast: Chia seed pudding made with coconut milk, topped with mixed berries and shredded unsweetened coconut.
Lunch: Grilled chicken breast with roasted asparagus and brown rice.
Dinner: Veggie burger on a whole wheat bun with lettuce, tomato, and mustard, served with a side of steamed broccoli.
Snack: Sliced pear with cinnamon.

Friday:
Breakfast: Whole grain waffles made with almond milk, topped with sliced bananas and a drizzle of agave nectar.
Lunch: Quinoa salad with roasted chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and an lemon-tahini dressing.
Dinner: Baked cod with steamed green beans and quinoa.
Snack: Cucumber slices with guacamole.

Saturday:
Breakfast: Greek yogurt alternative (coconut or soy) with mixed berries, chia seeds, and a sprinkle of unsweetened shredded coconut.
Lunch: Turkey wrap with lettuce, tomato, cucumber, and dijon mustard, served with a side of baby carrots and hummus.
Dinner: Stuffed bell peppers with quinoa, black beans, corn, and avocado.
Snack: Rice cake with almond butter and sliced banana.

Sunday:
Breakfast: Veggie omelet made with spinach, mushrooms, and tomatoes, served with whole wheat toast.
Lunch: Lentil salad with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, and an olive oil vinaigrette.
Dinner: Grilled chicken breast with roasted Brussels sprouts and sweet potato wedges.
Snack: Sliced kiwi with a sprinkle of chia seeds.

Remember to drink plenty of water throughout the day and adjust portion sizes as needed based on your caloric needs and activity level. Enjoy your healthy meals!
